RookieAnswered on 20 Sep 2019Is it wiser to lock in the premium rate or take a chance at renewing my premium rate every 5 years?If you buy 5 years renewable term, the premium for the start is cheaper then a term covered for 20 years or up to 65. However, for the renewable term, at every renewal, ur cost of insurance will increase and based on your age of ur new renewal term. Most importantly u need it for what purpose. If you know you want it to protect ur prime working year then u should get longer-term coverage to prevent the increase of premium over the years.Is there any difference between getting a term from advisors or directly online? Some say getting online is cheaper. But if you know a good & responsible advisor, u can consider getting from them cos is always good to have someone u trust to manage ur policy. Even if you have a question, u can directly ask them instead of having the trouble calling up CS and CS might not get you the answer you want.Is it necessary to add Early CI coverage? Individual preference. In term of premium, it will be more expensive than a CI covering Advanced conditions. But in term of claim, early CI might have a higher chance of claim. Most importantly you must have will be a health & surgical (hospital) insurance to cover your hospital bill.Based on your age, the premium for a term till 65 is quite cheap even with CI. Speak to someone you are comfortable with to find out which coverage best suits you.0 comments0
